name: Save the Children
description: A global non-profit organization dedicated to improving the lives of children in need.

name: Doctors Without Borders
description: An international medical humanitarian organization that provides emergency assistance to people affected by conflict, epidemics, disasters, or exclusion from healthcare.

name: Greenpeace
description: An independent global campaigning organization that acts to change attitudes and behavior, to protect and conserve the environment and to promote peace.

name: Amnesty International
description: A global movement of people fighting for human rights, campaigning for justice, and standing in solidarity with those whose rights are denied.

name: World Wildlife Fund
description: A conservation organization working to reduce the most pressing threats to the diversity of life on Earth.

name: The Nature Conservancy
description: A global environmental organization working to conserve the lands and waters on which all life depends.

name: Feeding America
description: A hunger relief organization working to end hunger in the United States through a nationwide network of food banks.

name: American Cancer Society
description: A non-profit organization dedicated to eliminating cancer as a major health problem by preventing cancer, saving lives, and diminishing suffering from cancer.

name: Habitat for Humanity
description: A non-profit organization that helps families build and improve places to call home.

name: St. Jude Children's Research Hospital
description: A pediatric treatment and research facility focused on children's catastrophic diseases, particularly leukemia and other cancers.
